item.author: Mostly Borrowed Ideas

item.content:encoded: Here's a cool paper estimating a model of demand for buying and playing videogames, using Steam playtime data. tl;dr: - Money is wasted bc you don't know before you buy a game how good it is - If you knew you could get 90% of your happiness at 40% the cost
item.author: alz

item.content:encoded: With differentiated products and heterogeneous consumers, it may be hard for choices to deliver maximal welfare. We might regret choices we make, and we might miss out on products we would have enjoyed. @ReimersImke and @criedl explore this https://t.co/7oy2CXB7GY
item.author: Joel Waldfogel

item.content:encoded: It is really weird that there is a stock market panic about DeepSeek when on the most simple of reading it is extraordinarily good news about the future productivity and cost effectiveness of Gen AI. Most of the economy benefit from it.
item.author: Joshua Gans

item.content:encoded: A story in three headlines* *(and his first tweet since 2021)
item.author: BuccoCapital Bloke

item.content:encoded: Nice to see Goldman reads my blog: "To evaluate cheapness in search of a tactical trading opportunity, one needs to equalize the sector exposures of different markets. After such an adjustment, the non-US equity markets are not as cheap as they first appear."
item.author: Lawrence Hamtil

item.content:encoded: At the American Economics Association I gave an overview on Working from Home trends, facts, figures and research. If anyone is interested here are the slides. Free to share, use for teaching, discussions etc. https://t.co/zZJnnL1Isf

item.content:encoded: Late Apex Partners sends a letter to $MTN's Board proposing various changes: 1) Replace CEO and CFO 2) Reset the Board and chairman resignation 3) Cut the dividend 4) Grow through asset-lite partnerships

item.content:encoded: Morningstar on the DeepSeek news: As the price of LLMs goes down, value and usage of public cloud vendors - $MSFT, $GOOG, $AMZN - will increase.

item.content:encoded: What's interesting about the world's biggest firms is that most are either platforms or, like NVIDIA, driven by platforms
item.author: Marshall Van Alstyne

item.content:encoded: I thought this was the more interesting news from the weekend, since Llama 4 is being trained on the largest cluster yet, over 100K H100s. The details are thin for sure, but Llama 4 and Grok 3 are datapoints for efficacy of larger training clusters so worth watching.
item.author: modest proposal

item.content:encoded: ummm...so ask DeepSeek "talk to me about how you differ from ChatGPT in simple terms" it says "First, both are developed by OpenAI, right? ..." and then "I'm part of ChatGPT Plus" So uh what the hell is going on here for real?
